name: Chapter 12: The Reunion
short_description: After a tense search, the group is joyously reunited with Finley. This incident strengthens their bond and determination to reach the ocean together.
events: Search for Finley, emotional reunion, strengthened bonds.
to_next_chapter: Reunited and determined, they continue their journey.

beats.long_title: Bubbles Leads a Desperate Search for Finley
beats.description: Bubbles rallies the group to conduct a frantic search for Finley, urging everyone to stay hopeful and focused.
As they search the calm river area, Lola spots some distinct markings that suggest Finley has passed through recently.
Encouraged by the clues, Bubbles, Guppy, and Lola follow the trail eagerly, calling out for Finley as they move.
During a brief pause, the group shares their worries and doubts about finding Finley, revealing their deep bond and reliance on each other.

beats.long_title: Hearing a Faint Call in the Distance
beats.description: Just as despair begins to set in, Guppy hears a faint, familiar sound from further down the river and alerts the group.

beats.long_title: The Group Races Towards the Sound
beats.description: The group speeds up, fueled by renewed hope, eager to find the source of the faint call they believe could be Finley.

beats.long_title: Bubbles, Lola, and Guppy Reunite with Finley
beats.description: With tears of joy, the group finally finds Finley, who is equally elated and relieved to see them.

beats.long_title: Finley Shares His Ordeal with the Group
beats.description: Finley recounts his experience and the difficulties he faced while separated, bringing the group closer together.

beats.long_title: The Group Vows to Reach the Ocean Together
beats.description: The emotional reunion and Finley's tale fill the group with renewed determination and a stronger bond to reach their ultimate goal, the ocean.

beats.long_title: The Group Continues Their Journey with New Resolve
beats.description: With strengthened spirits, the group sets off once again, more united and determined than ever to reach the ocean.
